Module project.chenlin_17
Package project.chenlin_17.Views

Class Ball

java.lang.Object
project.chenlin_17.Views.Ball
All Implemented Interfaces:
Movable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageBall, RubberBall
abstract class Ball extends Object implements Movable
This class contains the model for the ball.
Version:
Version1.0
update: December 29th
Author:
Lin CHEN
Note
It contains changes from the awt to javafx.
It contains changes of class variables according to Bob's code convention.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ball

      public Ball(javafx.geometry.Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB)
      Newly added private constructor for building basic ball components for the image ball as well as the geometric ball.
      Parameters:
      center - ball's start position
      radiusA - ball's defined radius x
      radiusB - ball's define radius y
      Note
      it is for code reusing.

    • Ball

      public Ball(javafx.geometry.Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB, javafx.scene.paint.Color inner, javafx.scene.paint.Color border)
      This constructor initializes the ball view.
      It sets the basic value for the ball setting variable.
      Parameters:
      center - ball's start position
      radiusA - ball's defined radius x
      radiusB - ball's define radius y
      inner - ball's inner color
      border - ball's border color
      Note
      set color for ball face
      javaFX provides double values and conversion to double is not needed

  • Method Details

    • makeBall

      protected abstract javafx.scene.shape.Shape makeBall(javafx.geometry.Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB)
      This function makes the geometric image ball face.
      Parameters:
      radiusA - expected radius x
      center - expected center position
      radiusB - expected radius y
      Returns:
      Ball built with defined radius and center

    • move

      public void move()
      This function continuously updates the ball's position to make the movement.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable
      Note
      RectangularShape in the AWT changed to Ellipse in JavaFX
      setLocation is not usable in javaFX's Point2D package

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(int x, int y)
      This function allows the player to set x and y speed
      Parameters:
      x - speed for x value
      y - speed for y value

    • setXSpeed

      public void setXSpeed(int x)
      This function allows the player to set x speed
      Parameters:
      x - speed for x value

    • setYSpeed

      public void setYSpeed(int y)
      This function allows the player to set x speed
      Parameters:
      y - speed for x value

    • reverseX

      public void reverseX()
      This function shifts the ball's x speed.
      If the ball's previous movement is left then it will turn to be right.
      Otherwise, it will turn to be left.
      It simulates ball's movement of hitting a wall.

    • reverseY

      public void reverseY()
      This function shifts the ball's x speed.
      If the ball's previous movement is up then it will turn to be down.
      Otherwise, it will turn to be up.
      It simulates ball's movement of hitting a wall.

    • getBorderColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getBorderColor()
      This function gets the ball's border color.
      Returns:
      ball's border color

    • getInnerColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getInnerColor()
      This function gets the ball's inner color.
      Returns:
      ball's inner color

    • getPosition

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getPosition()
      This function gets the ball's position.
      Returns:
      ball's position

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(javafx.geometry.Point2D p)
      This function allows the ball to be set to a designed position.
      Specified by:
      moveTo in interface Movable
      Parameters:
      p - designed position
      Note
      setLocation is not usable in javaFX's Point2D package
      RectangularShape in the AWT changed to Ellipse in JavaFX

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints(double width, double height)
      This function updates the up bound, lower bound, left bound and right bound of the ball, which is used for updating brick status.
      Parameters:
      width - ball container width
      height - ball container height
      Note
      setLocation is not usable in javaFX's Point2D package

      public int getSpeedX()
      This function gets the ball's x value
